content:
The worst, darkest demons are the ones working for fallen angels. These are fallen soul derms. These demons are the blood-thirsty souls that once existed in people who committed some of the most anti-compassionate, horrific acts, going back thousands of years—much of which occurred in the last 10,000 years and some within the last 100,000 years. These people created enough destruction upon humankind when they were alive that their souls became completely corrupted.

When a person commits horrific atrocities and they get to the end of their life, if they choose not to repent with their last breaths, then they forfeit the possibility, if available, of a communal gathering of angels upon death. If they don't get to that moment where they resolve and truly repent and feel the pain and the suffering they've caused, that soul becomes angel-less. That doesn't mean that if they do repent, they're absolved of all their sins. But by choosing not to repent, they've foregone what their free will has to offer, which is reconciling with their own soul on the atrocities and evildoing they've done. There's no rising above and traveling to the Light. There's no entering the Kingdom of Heaven. The free will of that soul has chosen not to experience any sympathy or empathy about the effects of the tragic, diabolical behavior they committed.

During these people's lives, fallen angels were already periodically watching them—watching their evildoings and torture upon others. Fallen angels may not have been influencing these people; they were just keeping an eye on them and preparing for their death. Immediately upon death, fallen angels tried to recruit these worst souls and convince them to do the fallen angels' bidding. That doesn't mean the worst souls always agree, because of their own free will. Yet when a soul does get convinced, then fallen angels must battle to keep their soul out of confinement—out of God's containment system—so that soul can become a demon.

Two types of fallen soul derms that fallen angels recruit and win are derms of devotion and derms of persuasion.

Find out more in Angels, Demons & Spiritual Tools by Anthony William.
with a story: https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.medicalmedium.com%2Fblog%2Ffallen-soul-derms&h=AT3LnkQreF6Kn_FL1xoHows2v2E01wqXrDW5oPNPRM0PwO9Y7eN67H6FO04ACkFphisDBWRKbQ9NhDaL2ddv2s8oM3uYjU0HJDkih8EUL8UBAWY-DtkKnZQyW4ZFazuwsa1X-G-AC6QvipJrIoTU0g&s=1

By manipulating our psyches religion can cause us to act out of fear, not love. "Fear God and keep his commandments...". You don't love what you fear. I did the whole "born-again, street preachin'" gig for years.  All the slaughter of Christianity's history attests to the nature of it. Man doesn't need some demon or devil to cause him to act horrifically, they do it on their own depending on their up bringing. "It's the tortured who become torturers", as Carl Jung said.
